    Command-line interface for TeXtidote.
    Author:
    Sylvain Hallér

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Main method. This method simply calls the static method mainLoop(), and exits with the return value of that method. The reason for this is is that we can test the main loop, and the test is not interrupted by calls to System.exit.
        Parameters:
        args - Command-line arguments
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if some file cannot be found or open

      • mainLoop

        public static int mainLoop(java.lang.String[] args,
                           java.io.InputStream in,
                           java.io.PrintStream out,
                           java.io.PrintStream err)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Delegate method of mainLoop(String[], InputStream, PrintStream, PrintStream, Class).
        Parameters:
        args - Command-line arguments
        in - A stream corresponding to the standard input
        out - A stream corresponding to the standard output
        err - A stream corresponding to the standard error
        Returns:
        An exit code
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if some file cannot be found or open

      • mainLoop

        public static int mainLoop(java.lang.String[] args,
                           java.io.InputStream in,
                           java.io.PrintStream out,
                           java.io.PrintStream err,
                           java.lang.Class<?> base_class)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Main method. The base_class argument can be set to a non-null value to indicate that the loop is being run inside a unit test. When given a filename, the loop will fetch it using Class.getResourceAsStream(String) instead of through a File object.
        Parameters:
        args - Command-line arguments
        in - A stream corresponding to the standard input
        out - A stream corresponding to the standard output
        err - A stream corresponding to the standard error
        base_class - Unit tests can pass a Class object to indicate that the loop is being run inside a unit test.
        Returns:
        An exit code
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if some file cannot be found or open

      • processDocument

        protected static java.util.List<Advice> processDocument(java.util.Scanner scanner,
                                                        java.lang.String filename,
                                                        Linter linter)
                                                 throws LinterException
        Applies the linter on a document.
        Parameters:
        scanner - A scanner open on the document to read
        filename - The name of the file for this document
        linter - The linter to apply on the document
        Returns:
        A list of advice. Any new advice produced by the execution of the linter on the document will be added to this list.
        Throws:
        LinterException - Thrown if reading the file produces an exception

      • readRules

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,RegexRule> readRules(java.lang.String filename)
        Reads a list of regex rules from a file
        Parameters:
        filename - The filename to read from
        Returns:
        A map of rule names to regex rules

      • readDictionary

                                                         throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Reads a list of word from an Aspell-generated file
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file to read from
        Returns:
        A set of words read from the file
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Thrown if file not found

      • printMap

                               java.util.Map<Range,Range> map)
        Prints the contents of an associative map
        Parameters:
        ps - The print stream to print to
        map - The associative map to print

      • addInnerFilesToQueue

        protected static void addInnerFilesToQueue(java.util.List<java.lang.String> inner_files,
                                           java.util.Set<java.lang.String> processed_filenames,
                                           java.util.Queue<java.lang.String> file_queue,
                                           java.lang.String current_filename)
        Adds filenames found in the input statements of the current file to the queue of files to process. A filename is added to the queue only if it has not already been processed earlier in the current run of the program.
        Parameters:
        inner_files - The list of new filenames
        processed_filenames - The set of filenames already processed
        file_queue - The queue of filenames waiting to be processed. This object is modified by the current method (new filenames can be added to it).
        current_filename - The name of the file currently being processed
